alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 4:47PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Douglas and west central Elbert Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 446 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles northeast of Black Forest, or 17 miles northeast of Colorado Springs, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elbert. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet
